article.headline: Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google's CEOs get grilled by House antitrust panel: live blog
article.body: Four of Big Tech's CEOs are appearing on Wednesday before the Democratic-run House Judiciary Committee's antitrust sub-panel, with lawmakers grilling the executives over the massive power of their companies. The Capitol Hill hearing, which began just after 1 p.m. Eastern Time, is featuring remote testimony from Amazon.com Inc.'s Jeff Bezos, Apple Inc.'s Tim Cook, Facebook Inc.'s Mark Zuckerberg and Sundar Pichai, who is the chief executive for Google and its parent company, Alphabet Inc. Prepared statements show the execs arguing that there is competition, and that their companies strengthen the U.S. Follow along with MarketWatch's live updates below. Shares in Amazon AMZN, +3.01%, Apple AAPL, +1.74%, Facebook FB, +0.26%  and GOOG, +1.97%  GOOGL, +1.82%  recently were trading higher in Wednesday's session, as the broad U.S. stock gauges SPX, +0.87%  DJIA, +0.56%  COMP, +1.39%  were also advancing.
